title: How Erdogan won after a close call in Turkey
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has won reelection, beating a challenge from a united opposition movement and cementing his tenure at the country’s helm into a third decade.

title: Two journalists stand trial in Iran for stories that sparked protests
description: Female reporters Elahe Mohammadi and Niloofar Hamedi brought early attention to the death of Mahsa Amini, which set off protests across Iran.

title: Amid unease in Moscow, Putin seeks to project calm after drone attack
description: The Kremlin said air defenses worked 'properly' even as it faced questions about introducing martial law in response to drone strikes in Moscow.

title: The notorious Russian jail holding U.S. journalist Evan Gershkovich
description: Based on descriptions from inmates, lawyers and prison monitors, The Post built a portrait of what life is like inside Lefortovo.

title: Indian girl stabbed to death on camera, and people just walked on by
description: The 16-year-old girl in New Delhi was stabbed repeatedly by a man in full view of the public in the latest case of brazen violence against women in India.

title: Peru battles record dengue outbreak, in a warning for a warming world
description: Recent warm and wet El Niño conditions — which scientists say are likely to be prevalent in the future due to climate change — are ideal for mosquitoes.

title: NATO peacekeepers injured in Kosovo: What to know about the clashes
description: Kosovo and Serbia have traded accusations amid worries about further unrest in the region, which has a history of ethnic violence.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Drone attacks on Moscow and Kyiv escalate tensions in capital cities
description: Civilian homes in Moscow were attacked for the first time since the war began. Kyiv was also reeling from destruction and debris.

title: Chinese vessel accused of looting U.K. warships that sunk after Pearl Harbor
description: Malaysia detained the cargo ship suspected of pillaging the HMS Prince of Wales and HMS Repulse, the gravesites of Royal Navy sailors killed in late 1941.

title: Teen who set deadly dorm fire was mad about phone confiscation, prosecutors say
description: A 15-year-old girl was charged as an adult, accused of igniting a fire inside a school in Guyana, killing 20 children. She faces 19 counts of murder.
